Meshes used for our testing were produced using isotropic
remeshing [20] (Figs. 2-4), feature sensitive remeshing [20]
(Fig. 5), centroidal Voronoi diagram based remeshing [22]
(Fig. 7) and geometry images [16] (Fig. 8). A fixed set of
parameters as described above was used in all experiments.
The first example is a discrete sphere with about 1000
vertices. As shown in Fig. 2, the shape is only slightly
changed with almost the same regularity, but the approx-
imation error is significantly reduced, maximum error by
more than 40% and average error reduced by about 75%.
We use the same colour coding scheme throughout the pa-
per, with blue, green, yellow, orange and finally red indi-
cating increasing errors. The same scale is used to ren-
der both input and optimised meshes. Since a sphere is
uniformly non-planar everywhere, a significant reduction
of approximation error is observed. Another example is
